fields.name: Antivirus Remdiation
fields.description:
"1] What Business Unit does this change impact? Health MR
2] Does this change impact shared infrastructure (Y/N)? N 
3] If yes, is the shared infrastructure affecting a BU under a known change freeze (Y/N)? Y
4] Is this change scheduled outside of a standard change window?  If yes, why? N 
5] What specific equipment / applications are involved?  nurseadm001 
6] What environment (QA, Test/Dev, Production)? Production 
7] Why are we doing this and will there be any expected downtime? Yes, SEP 12 Install/ Reboot required
8] Who will test the change before implementation? Assignee -
9] Who is testing this change after implementation? Eric Lemasters
10] What is the risk of this change if the change fails? N/A 
11] Is there a documented back out plan? N/A 
12] Who has approved the change from the Business Unit? Randy Whitlock
13] Include any related RM, IM, PR, or Project #: AntiVirus Remediation 
========================================================= 
Detailed Plan (Step-By-Step Implementation Process):
1. Place change ticket in WIP status. 
2. Log into servers list below in CI list 
3. Uninstall SAV10 
    3.1 Ensure all the references and folders are removed, you hasve to use the CleanWipe tool
    3.2  Reboot the server as needed
4. Log back into server
5. Install SEP12
    5.1 Reboot server as needed
6. Post reboot, open Symantec EndPoint Security and verify defination files are up to date and green
7. Open Network Connections>>Advanced>>Advanced Settings>>Provider order""tab"">>Be sure that Under Network Providers (Symantec SNAC Network Provider) is the last in the list.
8. After SEP12 installation ensure the folder C:\SEP 12 32-Bit All Content   is removed from the server
9. Verification complete [log off device if applicable if device is a server does a certain user need to be logged on]
10. Notify   Eric Lemasters <ericlemasters@technotects.com>  to test the server
11. Document and Close ticket and email US AV team of completion

Note: 
    a) CleanWipe tool is located on D:\SEP 12 32-Bit All Content
    b) SEP12 Setup files are located at  D:\SEP 12 32-Bit All Content

List:
 nurseadm001"

fields.name: Reseat Memory on server WKCCHSTGDBBS02
fields.short_description: CDS00001576  BUA: Justan Picard , Reseat Memory on
fields.description:
"Required Questions for all Changes to the WK Environment:
1) What Business Unit does this change impact?
Aspen
2) Does this change impact shared infrastructure? Y/N
No
3) If yes, is the shared infrastructure affecting a BU under a known change freeze (e.g. Tax Compliance or any other Business Unit)?  Y/N
No
4) Is this change scheduled outside of a standard change window?  If yes, why?
No
5) What specific equipment / applications are involved?

WKCCHSTGDBBS02

6) What environment (QA, Test/Dev, Production)?
Staging
7) Why are we doing this and will there be any expected downtime?
Memory needs to be reseated, server needs to be turned off to carry out this task
8) Who will test the change before implementation?
The project team tested the implementation
9) Who is testing this change after implementation?  (Note:  If production server and/or flagged as ""1-critical"" AOI,  a BU tester is required) 
Project team will be testing after the implementation and Justan Picard and Linda Elkins will be the testers on WK side
10) What is the risk of this change if the change fails?  
Nothing
11) Is there a documented back out plan?
Yes
12) Who has approved the change from the Business Unit?  Justan Picard
13) Include any related RM, IM, PR, or Project #: Project CDS00001576
=========================================================
Detailed Plan (Step-By-Step Implementation Process):
1.            Place change ticket in WIP status
2.            Log into server WKCCHSTGDBBS02 
3.            Verify that this is a passive node, if no, then perform a failover resources to the other node
4.            Turn this server off
5.            Inform the PTC Hardware install team to reseat the memory
6.            When the work is finish, then turn on the server
7.            Verify the issue is nor still happening
8.            Inform the customer
9.            Close the ticket"

fields.name: NetIQ Install
fields.short_description: Install Netiq NetIQ with MSCS & SQL modules on clu
fields.description:
"Required Questions for all Changes to the WK Environment:

1) What Business Unit does this change impact?   LoisLaw
2) Does this change impact shared infrastructure? Y/N: N
3) If yes, is the shared infrastructure affecting a BU under a known change freeze (e.g. Tax Compliance or any other Business Unit)?  Y/N: N
4) Is this change scheduled outside of a standard change window?  If yes, why? No
5) What specific equipment / applications are involved?  

NASRVTX95789
NASRVTX95790

6) What environment (QA, Test/Dev, Production)?Production
7) Why are we doing this and will there be any expected downtime? Uninstall / Install Netiq NetIQ with MSCS & SQL modules on cluster nodes NASRVTX95789 & NASRVTX95790 .Yes downtime 
8) Who will test the change before implementation? None
9) Who is testing this change after implementation?  (Note:  If production server and/or flagged as ""1-critical"" AOI,  a BU tester is required) Bryon.Mayo@wolterskluwer.com-
10) What is the risk of this change if the change fails?  Netiq NetIQ with MSCS & SQL modules will not be installed
11) Is there a documented back out plan? Y
12) Who has approved the change from the Business Unit?Bryon.Mayo@wolterskluwer.com
13) Include any related RM, IM, PR, or Project #:RM: R2:000012790226 
=========================================================
Detailed Plan (Step-By-Step Implementation Process):

1. Put the change the status to WIP .
2. Login to server passive cluster node , NASRVTX95790
3. Download the Setup Files (Adv Mon Agent and All Adv Mon Module) from the following link:
http://intranet.dell.com/services/IS/Team%20Websites/ACP/Downloads/Pages/AdvancedIntelMonitoring.aspx (downloads)
Latest softwares are also located on share drive :  \\10.204.34.102\d$\sunit\netiq
4. Uninstall NetIQ if any previous version 
5. Install NetIQ latest version 7 - Run the Setup as per SOP (follow installation guide for both, NetIQ agent and modules)  and install install   NETIQ with MSCS &SQL modules.
6.verify that NetIQ services  with modules are up on the server as per SOP.
7. Now logon onto active cluster NASRVTX95789 and install as per steps 5 and 6 above on node NASRVTX95789. Verfiy that installtaion is successfull. 
8. Inform change status to Bryon.Mayo@wolterskluwer.com   and Amit_Sharma1@dell.com and then Close ticket."

fields.name: Add Security Groups

"Required Questions for all Changes to the WK Environment:

WKHMRHYPERCP03

5. Inform hugo_tribouillier@Dell.com  the status of change.

fields.name: Security Group Deletion
fields.short_description: BUA: Susan Claudio - Delete security group & Chang
fields.description:
"1] What Business Unit does this change impact? CLS-CT

2] Does this change impact shared infrastructure (Y/N)? Y

3] If yes, is the shared infrastructure affecting a BU under a known change freeze (Y/N)? Y

4] Is this change scheduled outside of a standard change window?  If yes, why? N

5] What specific equipment / applications are involved? ""WKSRVTX95010""

6] What environment (QA, Test/Dev, Production)? Production

7] Why are we doing this and will there be any expected downtime? Susan Claudio is requesting to delete a duplicate group and change the type on the one that they are keeping. No expected down time. 

8] Who will test the change before implementation? Assignee

9] Who is testing this change after implementation? Susan Claudio.

10] What is the risk of this change if the change fails? None

11] Is there a documented back out plan? Yes

12] Who has approved the change from the Business Unit? Susan Claudio

13] Include any related RM, IM, PR, or Project #: RM # R2:000012790347


=========================================================


Detailed Plan (Step-By-Step Implementation Process):

1. Set Change To Work In Progress

2. Logon To Associated Server WKSRVTX95010

3. run dsa.exe

4. Delete ""CLS-C & G All"" Group.

5. Change the group type of ""CLS-C&G All"" to ""Security"" (it is currently configured as a Distribution group).

6. Go to the ""Member Of"" tab click ""Add"" and type ""CLS-ERP"" (without the quotation marks) and select ""CLS-ERP Bulletin Distribution""

9. E-mail the following people to inform the results of the CM
Leon_Torres@Dell.com
susan.claudio@wolterskluwer.com

9. Document And Close Change Ticket"

fields.name: Create new DNS entry for PubFussion FTP
fields.short_description: BUA Rich.Biborosch - RM 12832805 Create new DNS en
fields.description:
"Required Questions for all Changes to the WK Environment:
1) What Business Unit does this change impact? MR-Medical Research
2) Does this change impact shared infrastructure?  Y
3) If yes, is the shared infrastructure affecting a BU under a known change freeze (e.g. Tax Compliance or any other Business Unit)?  Y
4) Is this change scheduled outside of a standard change window?  N  If yes, why? N/A
5) What specific equipment / applications are involved? WKSRVTX95008  - DNS Management Console
6) What environment (QA, Test/Dev, Production)? Production
7) Why are we doing this and will there be any expected downtime? Rich Biborosch /John LaRouche need a new DNS entry on the INTERNAL DNS server for Pubfusion FTP Server; No, there is no expected downtime.
8) Who will test the change before implementation? No One.
9) Who is testing this change after implementation?  (Note:  If production server and/or flagged as ""1-critical"" AOI,  a BU tester is required) Assignee
10) What is the risk of this change if the change fails?  No Risk, request is related to a new DNS entry.
11) Is there a documented back out plan? No, the backout plan is simple.
12) Who has approved the change from the Business Unit? Rich.Biborosch/John LaRouche
13) Include any related RM, IM, PR, or Project #: RM R2:000012832805 =========================================================
Detailed Plan (Step-By-Step Implementation Process):
1. Set on a WIP status the ticket
2. Logon to the server WKSRVTX95008 with domain admin account
3. Open the DNS Management Console and expand the Forward Lookup zone folder
4. Locate lww.com zone and create a new CNAME entry as follows:

Alias name:         ftp.journals
FQDN:   ftp.journals.lww.com
FQDN for target host:     jnl-eus-ol-ftp1.cloudapp.net f. Close the DNS Management Console.

5.  Notify Rich.Biborosch@wolterskluwer.com; Luis_Luna@dell.com the CM's outcome
6. Document and close CM"

fields.name: Clone VM to fix snapshot issue
fields.short_description: BUA: Otte, Jim- Clone VM to fix snapshot issue on
fields.description:
"Required Questions for all Changes to the WK Environment:

1) What Business Unit does this change impact? FS 

2) Does this change impact shared infrastructure? N

3) If yes, is the shared infrastructure affecting a BU under a known change freeze (e.g. Tax Compliance or any other Business Unit)?  N

4) Is this change scheduled outside of a standard change window?  If yes, why?N

5) What specific equipment / applications are involved?  WKFSXINTGAPFD01 

6) What environment (QA, Test/Dev, Production)? Development

7) Why are we doing this and will there be any expected downtime? To remove hidden snapshots/Server will be down till cloning gets completed

8) Who will test the change before implementation?Assignee

9) Who is testing this change after implementation?  (Note:  If production server and/or flagged as ""1-critical"" AOI,  a BU tester is required)
Lo, Pin On <pinon.lo@wolterskluwer.com>

10) What is the risk of this change if the change fails?  No risk

11) Is there a documented back out plan? Power on original VM

12) Who has approved the change from the Business Unit? Otte, Jim [Jim.Otte@wolterskluwer.com] 

13) Include any related RM, IM, PR, or Project # Snapshot remediation /Proactive task
=========================================================
Detailed Plan (Step-By-Step Implementation Process):


1. Connect to the Cloud vcenter
2. Power off VM
3. Rename to vmname_old
4. Clone VM(verify datastore with enough disk space) and use original name for destination VM
5. Once completed power on cloned VM and verify windows and logs
6. Notify customer tester for validation
7. Notify GIS Storage Backup-CommVault  to modify backups to point to new VM ID (cloned VM)
8. Delete from disk vmname_old
9. close change"

fields.name: Install Commvault idata agent on server WKGPOSCI2DBBD01
fields.short_description: BUA: Rick Fyrant - Install Commvault idata agent
fields.description:
"Required Questions for all Changes to the WK Environment:
1) What Business Unit does this change impact? GPO
2) Does this change impact shared infrastructure? N
3) If yes, is the shared infrastructure affecting a BU under a known change freeze (e.g. Tax Compliance or any other Business Unit)? N
4) Is this change scheduled outside of a standard change window?  If yes, why?  Yes
5) What specific equipment / applications are involved? 
WKGPOSCI2DBBD01
6) What environment (QA, Test/Dev, Production)? Development
7) Why are we doing this and will there be any expected downtime? RT R2:R2:000021005166 and RM R2:000012264061 Install Commvault data agent.
There will be downtime due to a reboot of the server, after install the Commvault idata agent.
8) Who will test the change before implementation? Assignee
9) Who is testing this change after implementation?  (Note:  If production server and/or flagged as ""1-critical"" AOI,  a BU tester is required) Assignee
10) What is the risk of this change if the change fails? The server won't have installed the Commvault data agent.
11) Is there a documented back out plan? Yes, please see Back Out Plan
12) Who has approved the change from the Business Unit?  Rick Fryant Rick.Fryant@wolterskluwer.com
13) Include any related RM, IM, PR, or Project #: RT R2:R2:000021005166 and RM R2:000012264061

=========================================================

Detailed Plan (Step-By-Step Implementation Process):

1. Put the CM in WIP.
2. Please notify to the WK DBA Team (DL-WK-InfrastructureDBA@Dell.com) about the start of this CM.
3. Login into a jump server.
4. Login into server WKGPOSCI2DBBD01
5. Install the Commvault idata agent as per SOP.
6. Please notify to the WK DBA Team (DL-WK-InfrastructureDBA@Dell.com) before of reboot the server, to stop SQL databases on this server (if required), and wait for their reply.
7. Please reboot the server WKGPOSCI2DBBD01
8. Once the server reboots, DBA team will perform a quick health check.
9. Logoff from server WKGPOSCI2DBBD01
10. Logoff from jump server.
11. Please notify to the following people: Rick.Fryant@wolterskluwer.com and paulo_aguiar@dell.com 
12. Please document and close the CM."
